attemptslimit.label: What is the limit of tries before you time the user out?

suspensionlength.label: What is the length of the user being suspended from forms?

require_login_whitelist.label: Require Login Whitelist
require_login_whitelist.comment: Regular expression that is used to match request strings that do not need customer authentication.

use_ipfilter_frontend.label: Filer IP address on the frontend

ipfilter_frontend.label: IP pattern
ipfilter_frontend.comment:
Use regular expressions to set rules for different IP exclusion and inclusion scenarios. Below are some common examples:

192\.168\.0.* - This is the most basic and common use of a regular expression. This configuration will exclude traffic from your own computer.

Exclude or include only traffic from a range of IP addresses, e.g. from 63.212.171.1 to 63.212.171.9. Enter 63\.212\.171\.[1-9] into the 'Filter Pattern' field.

captcha.comment: In order for reCaptcha to work please enter valid public and private keys. You can get those by visiting this page
captcha.label: reCaptcha

hpp_api_key.label: Project Honeypot http:BL Access API key

hpp_comment_threshold.label: http:BL Comment spammer threat score threshold

hpp_threatscore_threshold.label: http:BL Last seen threshold
hpp_threatscore_threshold.comment: Each suspicious IP address is given a threat score. This scored is asigned by Project Honey Pot basing on various factors, such as the IPs activity or the damage done during the visits. The score is a number between 0 and 255, where 0 is no threat at all and 255 is extremely harmful. In the field above you may set the threat score threshold. IP address with a score greater than the given number will be regarded as harmful. read up

honeypotAccountCreateTime.label: Minimum time for registration in seconds

enableSpamIndexing.label: Enable spam indexing for input fields

spamIndexLevel.label: Set max. spam index trust level
spamIndexLevel.comment: An index of 2.5 should be enough to block average spam logins The lower the level, the higher the level, the more spam gets through

activeerror.label: Use Active Error Pages
activeerror.comment: NOTE THIS PART OF THE MODULE IF NOT ACTIVE IT'S SELF

err500_fake404.label: Fake a 404
err500_fake404.comment: The goal in using this is to not display a crack in the system, but quitely report it to someone and 404 the user.

err500_local.label: Url/path
err500_local.comment: Use a Url of path for the 500 Page you wish to use. NOTE that one example is to use a CMSPage

err404_local.label: Url/path
err404_local.comment: Use a Url of path for the 404 Page you wish to use. NOTE that one example is to use a CMSPage

honeypage_pot.label: Auto Honeypot Pages
honeypage_pot.comment: create a few pages to use as honey pots. CSV

honeypage_error.label: Error page for that accidental triggered, .0001% guy that was poking around and got caught in the pot.
honeypage_error.comment: just pas the url/path, and this will be used for all pots.

genadmin_settings.label: General admin login and access settings

use_ipfilter_admin.label: Filer IP address on the frontend

ipfilter_admin.label: IP pattern
ipfilter_admin.comment:
Use regular expressions to set rules for different IP exclusion and inclusion scenarios. Below are some common examples:

192\.168\.0.* - This is the most basic and common use of a regular expression. This configuration will exclude traffic from your own computer.

Exclude or include only traffic from a range of IP addresses, e.g. from 63.212.171.1 to 63.212.171.9. Enter 63\.212\.171\.[1-9] into the 'Filter Pattern' field.

allow_request.label: Allow users to request Admin access

requestemail.label: Email to notify
requestemail.comment: NOTE: This is where a request will be going for. It is worth noting that auto-create wouldn't negate the need for requests.

allow_bypass.label: Allow bypass of LDAP if a user

port.label: Port
port.comment: Ex: 389 for non ssl and 636 or 3269 for SSL/TLS

autocreate.label: Create admin user if in LDAP
autocreate.comment: Note: in order to user this there must be one of two conditions met. 1.) the user login in must have search rights or 2.) the search user information must be entered

failed_attempts_login.label: Number of Unsuccessful Attempts to Login
failed_attempts_login.comment: If 0 is specified, Login form will be always available.

searcher.label: LDAP searcher Configuration
searcher.comment: Note: in some systems you can only use a user that has been granted access to search instead of the user that is trying to log in. In this case you may enter this user in here.

port.label: Port
port.comment: Ex: 389 for non ssl and 636 or 3269 for SSL/TLS

searcherusername.label: The Searcher user's name
searcherusername.comment: Note: this is a user that can search for information on the user loging in. If the users trying to login, can auto add them selfs adn have search rights then this would not be needed.Ex: user.name

port.label: Port
port.comment: Ex: 389 for non ssl and 636 or 3269 for SSL/TLS

autocreate.label: Create admin user if in LDAP
autocreate.comment: Note: in order to user this there must be one of two conditions met. 1.) the user login in must have search rights or 2.) the search user information must be entered
